meanings.sent1: The sunrise antedating the sunset was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: In history, the invention of the wheel antedated the discovery of fire.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit tried antedating the tortoise in the race, but it didn't work out well.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter always seemed to antedate any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation helped the students understand how the concept of fractions antedates decimals.

meanings.sent1: The letter was antedated to show it was sent before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The artifacts found in the cave antedate any known civilization in the region.
meanings.sent3: The detective suspected foul play when he found the antedated signature on the will.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom seemed to antedate her years, making her advice highly valued.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins antedate the written records, leaving historians to speculate about their origins.

meanings.definition: Antedated: dated before the actual date
meanings.sent1: The antedated documents were discovered during the audit.
meanings.sent2: The antedated ticket caused confusion at the entrance to the event.
meanings.sent3: The antedated newspaper headline predicted an event that hadn't occurred yet.
meanings.sent4: His antedated membership card granted him access to exclusive events.
meanings.sent5: The antedated signature on the painting raised questions about its authenticity.
